metadata.title: CVE-2023-2861 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - low
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the 9p passthrough filesystem (9pfs) implementation inQEMU. The 9pfs server did not prohibit opening special files on the hostside, potentially allowing a malicious client to escape from the exported9p tree by creating and opening a device file in the shared folder.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-2861` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu-block-extra - 1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu5
qemu-guest-agent - 1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu5
qemu-system - 1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu5
qemu-system-arm - 1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu5
qemu-system-common - 1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu5
qemu-system-data - 1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu5
qemu-system-gui - 1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu5
qemu-system-mips - 1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu5
qemu-system-misc - 1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu5
qemu-system-ppc - 1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu5
qemu-system-s390x - 1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu5
qemu-system-sparc - 1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu5
qemu-system-x86 - 1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu5
qemu-system-x86-xen - 1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu5
qemu-system-xen - 1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu5
qemu-user - 1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu5
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu5
qemu-user-static - 1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu5
qemu-utils - 1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qemu package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:8.0.4+dfsg-1ubuntu5').
